Cathy Butler Brotherton
=======================



Councilmember Place 4
---------------------



|  |  |
| --- | --- |
| ![Cathy Butler Brotherton](https://www.hursttx.gov/home/showpublishedimage/13837/638696062558170000) Cathy Butler Brotherton  **Councilmember (Place 4)** [cathy.brotherton@hursttx.gov](mailto:cathy.brotherton@hursttx.gov)   1505 Precinct Line Road | Cathy Butler Brotherton is a long time resident of Hurst, Texas. She has dedicated her life to education and helping build a better future for her students. Cathy retired from Birdville ISD after 28 years as a teacher and reading specialist. She continues to be devoted to helping citizens achieve the highest quality of life in her community in Hurst.     **Professions**   Butler Property Company - Realtor   Reading Specialist - Continues to work with students with reading challenges   Birdville ISD - Retired after 28 years as a teacher and reading specialist   **Community Service**   Hurst Parks and Recreation Board — Appointed to the Board in 2015 -2018   Hurst Citizens Police Academy - 2017   Hurst Citizens Fire Academy Alumni Association (HCFAAA) - Member since 2013 - Served as Secretary and Treasurer   Served on the Hurst Neighborhood Advisory Board   Citizens on Patrol (COPS) since 2017   HURST 101 - 1st CLASS in 2013   Teacher of the Year for Elementary - Birdville ISD   Fort Worth Business Press Women of Influence in Texas     **Education**   Graduate of North Texas State University - Business Education & Secondary Certification   Texas Women’s University - Reading Recovery Certification   University of Texas at Arlington - Elementary Certification     **Family**   Cathy moved to Hurst in 1970 with her parents, Marie and John W. Butler. The annual John W. Butler Senior Citizen’s Dinner in Hurst at Christmas was started by her father and named in his honor after his death. Cathy is married to Bob Brotherton and has 2 daughters and 5 grandchildren. |
